citation.article-title: Lactobacillus acidipiscis sp. nov. and Weissella thailandensis sp. nov., isolated from fermented fish in Thailand.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Lactobacillus acidipiscis sp. nov.
Lactobacillus acidipiscis (a.ci.di'pis.cis. L. adj. acidus sour; L. n. piscis fish; L. adj. acidipiscis pertaining to sour fish, an isolation source of strains of this species)
Cells are Gram-positive rods (0.4-0.6x1.2-5.0 μm), non-motile, non-sporing and occur singly, in pairs and in chains.
Colonies on MRSH agar plate are circular, slightly convex with an entire margin and unpigmented.
Microaerophilic.
Utilizes D-glucose homofermentatively and does not produce gas from glucose.
Produces L-lactic acid from glucose (>91%).Negative for catalase activity, nitrate reduction, hydrolysis of arginine, aesculin, gelatin and starch and for the formation of slime from sucrose.
Most strains show no reaction in litmus milk.
Grows at 25-37 °C but not at 15 or 42 °C.
Does not grow at pH 4.0 or pH 8.5.
Grows in 10% NaCl.
Some strains grow in 12% NaCl.

Produces acid from D-fructose, D-galactose, D-glucose and D-mannose but does not produce acid from cellobiose, gluconate, D-melibiose, D-melezitose, methyl α-D-glucoside, raffinose, D-sorbitol and dxylose.
Some strains produce acid weakly from lactose and salicin.
Variable reactions for D-amygdalin, L-arabinose, glycerol, maltose, D-mannitol, L-rhamnose, sucrose and D-trehalose.
Requires niacin and calcium pantothenate for growth.
Major cellular fatty acids are straight-chained C16:0 and C18:1.
L-Lys-D-Asp in the cell wall.
The G+C content of the DNA ranges from 38.6 to 41.5 mol%.
Isolated from fermented fish (pla-ra and pla-chom) in Thailand.
The type strain is FS60-1T (=PCU 207T=NRIC 0300T=HSCC 1411T=JCM 10692T=TISTR 1386T).
The type strain has the characteristics given in the description of species and in Tables 1 and 2.
The G+C content of the type strain is 38.7 mol%.
